ovdesc.p: The FATCA. PARAMETER is used to record the details of the institution’s agreement with the IRS, for example the effective date of the FATCA provisions, status (opt-in/opt-out) and certain default conditions.

desc.p: The system will default the value for address type (in FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO) specified above based on the country code in the linked DE ADDRESS record.

For example, if ADDR TYPE is set as MAIL and ADDRESS.RECORD is set as PRINT.1, for customer ID (100252) in Company 1 (GB0010001), the system will read the DE ADDRESS record GB0010001.C-100252.PRINT.1 and get the ADDRESS COUNTRY from GB COUNTRY field and default the same in FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO If there is no matching DE ADDRESS record, then there will be no default.
If DE ADDRESS record changes, the changes to FATCA customer record have to be manually carried out.

If the address details in FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO are to be defaulted from existing DE ADDRESS records, the defaulting conditions can be specified here (in ADDR.TYPE and ADDR.RECORD fields). The ADDR.TYPE is the address type related to the DE.ADDRESS record in ADDR.RECORD field
Validation rules
The system will accept the following values

p.p: HOLD.MAIL
INCARE
MAIL
PERMANENT
PO.BOX

desc.p: The FATCA.STATUS of the account (ie the account classification) can either be manually entered or automatically defaulted based on the rules specified. If automatic classification is required, this field has to be set as YES.

If the default recalcitrant status for entities is different (to the DEFAULT RECALCITRANT STATUS defined above), the same can be set up in this field. For example, in the case of FFIs, the equivalent of ‘RECALCITRANT’ will be ‘NON.PARTICIPATING’.

If no response is received from the client by the cut-off date, the account will be considered recalcitrant. At that time, the check will have to be made to see whether the account is dormant (no contact could be established). If the account is Dormant, the classification will be updated based on the default status specified in this field.
Validation rules
Must be value value from the FATCA.TAX.STATUS application

desc.p: The FATCA statuses (Account classifications) are user defined. The classifications are defined in the FATCA TAX STATUS application. The default FATCA TAX STATUS pertaining to ‘Inactive’ accounts or ‘owners’ is specified in this field.

Consider an account with joint or beneficial owners. If there is a need to change the list of beneficial or joint owners by removing the existing owners, one of the options could be to remove the details from FATCA record (deleting the multi-value). Another option could be to mark the status as ‘INACTIVE’ (the status defined in this field) and leave the multi-values untouched. So, for any due diligence or documentation checks, the owners marked inactive will be ignored.
Validation rules
A valid status as defined in FATCA TAX STATUS

This field is used to set a frequency specific to companies based on which the close of business job (FATCA.DOC.BASED.STATUS) will identify the expired documents in FATCA supplementary info and process the FATCA status as “RECALCITRANT/DORMANT”.
This field is a standard frequency field. The processing of expired documents for a company will be done based on the frequency set in this field.

For example, If FATCA status update based on expired documents to be processed every business day for a company starting from date 01-july-2013, the DOC.STATUS.FREQ need to be set as “01 JUL 2013 BSNSS”
Validation Rules:

p.p: This field is in two parts. Next Run Date: 1-9 Date characters, Application Frequency: 1-5 type SS.
D(aily) (Every day) Tomorrow.
B(snss) (Every business day) Next working day after today
T(wmth) (Twice a month, 15th and last day) The next 15th or month end from today, whichever is sooner.
Wn (Every n weeks) n weeks from today.

Mnndd (Every nn months on the dd day). If today’s date is less than dd, the next date is day dd in nn months from last month, otherwise it is day dd in nn months form the current month. If this date does not exist (e.g. 30th February) the previous day is assumed (28th or 29th February).

desc.p: The dormant accounts will be identified based on the value specified in the field (identified based on DORM IDENT FIELD) in the application specified in this field.
For example, if dormancy is identified based on CUSTOMER STATUS field in CUSTOMER, the parameter set-up will be as under:
DORM IDENT APP : CUSTOMER
DORM IDENT FIELD : CUSTOMER.STATUS
DORM IDENT OPERAND : EQ
DORM IDENT VALUE : 32
Any client with CUSTOMER STATUS of 32 will be considered Dormant as per the above setting.
Validation rules
Valid Values are,

p.p: CUSTOMER
FATCA.CUSTOMER.SUPPLEMENTARY.INFO

desc.p: The field on which the dormant identification will be based on.

The operand linked to the field DORM.IDENT.field and DORM.IDENT.VALUE

Allowed values EQ
The value in the associated field specified in DORM.IDENT.FIELD to determine whether the conditions have been complied with or not.
For example, if the dormant identification is based on the customer status field, the set up will be
DORM.IDENT.APP : CUSTOMER
DORM.IDENT.FIELD: CUSTOMER.STATUS
DORM.IDENT.OPERAND: EQ
DORM.IDENT.VALUE : 16
Validation rules
Any
This field determines the effective date of the agreement with the IRS.
For agreements entered into up to the 30th June 2013, the effective date will be 1st July 2013.
For agreements entered into after 30th June 2013, the agreement date will be the effective date.
Validation Rules:

p.p: NOINPUT field
1-9 Type D Standard date format -(YYYYMMDD)

desc.p: The EIN (Employer identification Number) is a unique nine-digit number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to business entities operating in the United States for the purposes of identification.

The number of days by when the existing clients (FFIs) have to furnish the documents required under FATCA. The cut-off will be based on Effective date of FATCA Agreement plus the number of days specified in this field. As per the requirement, this is currently one year
For example considering an effective date of 01 July 2013, the documents are required by 30 Jun 2014.
Validation rules
Numeric – Valid number of days

The number of days after the expiry date by when renewed documents have to be received. If the documents expire and are not renewed by the due date (Expiry date or Expiry Date + Grace), the account will be classified as ‘Recalcitrant’ provided the AUTO.STATUS.UPDATE is set to YES.
Validation rules
Numeric – Valid number of days
The company for which the parameter record applies.
The FATCA.PARAMETER table is a company level table. The item id to the parameter record must exist as a valid company code on the company file
Validation Rules
Up to 11 Alphanumeric characters. Should be a valid Company Code.
The logic to calculate the Indicia Strength will be built into the API that is specified in this field.
Validation rules

p.p: Must be the id of a record in EB.API.
If no routine is attached here then the Indicia strength will not be calculated.

desc.p: Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the up to 999 Local elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These local elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.
The name of the new element(s), as well as the Format and Validation Rules, must be defined in the Local Tables and Local.Ref.Table prior to their use in the FATCA.PARAMETER application .
Validation Rules

p.p: Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this local reference field. Multi-value field. (Optional or Mandatory input according to definition in Local Table for this Local Reference element.)
As defined by the User within the individual Local Table

desc.p: The field will be used in conjunction with NEW CLNT DOC DAYS to determine the cut-off date by when the client has to furnish the documents.

p.p: If the value specified is ‘OPENING’, the cut-off date will be determined based on the client opening date.
If ‘REQUEST’, the cut-off date will be determined based on when the documents were requested (REQ.DATE field in FATCA.CUSTOMER.SUPPLEMENTARY.INFO).

desc.p: Validation rules
Valid values are OPENING and REQUEST

As per the regulation, the due diligence process for the new accounts will have to be completed within a specified period (90 days). The clients will have to furnish all the required documents within the specified period. The number of days specified here used in conjunction with NEW CLNT DAYS FROM will be used to determine the cut-off dates by when the client has to furnish the documents.
Validation rules
Numeric – Valid number of days

The number of days by when the other existing clients (i.e. other than FFIs) have to furnish the documents required under FATCA. The cut-off will be based on Effective date plus the number of days specified in this field. As per the requirement, this is currently two years
For example considering the effective date of 1st July 2013, the documents are required by 30th June 2015.
Validation rules
Numeric – Valid number of days

The STATUS field is used to specify whether the entity is opt-in or opt-out. In the case of opt-out locations, the client identification/account classification will still be done but there will be no withholding or reporting. If there are US accounts in opt-out locations, they are expected to be either closed or transferred out to other opt in locations.
If this field is OPT_IN the entity is opted in
If this field is OPT_OUT this entity is opted out
Validation Rules

p.p: Mandatory field
Valid values are, OPT_IN and OPT_OUT
